Class HalfBook<T extends IOrder>

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.lob.orderbook.HalfBook<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Ask or Bid depending on whether this is going to be an Ask book or a Bid book.
public class HalfBook<T extends IOrder> extends Object
A bid or ask book (depending on parameters). A fully order book contains one bid book and one ask book. Bid orders are processed against the ask book, and ask orders against the bid book.

  • Method Details

    • addOrder

      public void addOrder(T order)
      Adds an order to the book. If the same trader has placed an order for the same price and ticker, the new order replaces the old one in the book.
      Parameters:
      order - The IOrder object to be added.

    • removeOrder

      public void removeOrder(T order)
      Removes an order from the book. Comparison is based on reference to the same object.
      Parameters:
      order - The order to be removed

    • processOrder

      public OrderOutcome processOrder(IOrder o, long time)
      Processes Ask/Bid Order against Bidbook/Askbook. Bid orders: start from the cheapest posted ask (i.e., offer), and see if your bid is equal or higher. If yes, buy that ask/offer. If the bid quantity is less than the offered, create a trade record, and deduct the bought amount from the ask order. Otherwise, create a trade record for the ask amount, remove the ask order from the queue, deduct the ask amount from the bid amount, and repeat processing the bid with the next more expensive ask. Ask orders: start from the higher bider (i.e., offer), and see if your ask is equal or lower to that (i.e., you would be happy with even less). If yes, sell to that bid. If the ask quantity is less than the offered, create a trade record, and deduct the sold amount from the bid order. Otherwise, create a trade record for the ask amount, remove the bid order from the queue, deduct the bid amount from the ask amount, and repeat processing the ask with the next lower bid.
      Parameters:
      o - The ca.yorku.cmg.lob.tradestandards#IOrder implementing object to be processed
      time - The time processing was requested. Will reflect any orders and trades generated.
      Returns:
      An object of type OrderOutcome containing a list of trades materializing, and the unfulfilled part of the order. If fully fulfilled, quantity of the returned "unfulfilled" order is zero. The calling environment is responsible for updating the order in its resident book (e.g., bid in the bidbook), i.e., remove it if fully fulfilled, or replace it with the unfulfilled part.

    • printAllOrders

      public String printAllOrders(boolean header)
      Print the contents of the book
      Parameters:
      header - true if header should be included, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      A string ready to print.

    • printOrdersForTicker

      public String printOrdersForTicker(String ticker, boolean header)
      Print the contents of the book pertaining to a specific security ("Ticker")
      Parameters:
      ticker - The ticker for which the book is to be printed
      header - true if header should be included, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      A string ready to print.
